Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery plate; cream slip; underside slipped with glaze bands; underside of rim glazed, outside band of chevrons; guilloche decoration on top of rim; on outside of floor band of metopal design, alternating rosettes and solid squares; dividing bands have added red bands lined in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 214, no. 32)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 103, pl. XXX, no. 308.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1099)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5979 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
